The Systems Analyst, Identity and Access will be a significant contributor on the Enterprise Directory Services Team that will conceptualize, design, and implement identity management systems for a diverse operational ecosystem. The ideal candidate is someone with recent technical experience in Active Directory technologies, Azure AD, SSO, and other components of AD domain and forest management. This role will be focused on supporting the IAM Engineer and IAM Architect, leading with best practice-based design principles and proscriptive technical guidance. The team is responsible for delivering strategic recommendations to many operations teams, working towards resolving technical debt, providing support for new strategic initiatives, and solutioning for the future. This role is a great opportunity to learn more about the Ski industry and work with a team to define the future of workforce identity at Alterra.

General Responsibilities:

Responsible for timely delivery of projects as assigned by the Sr. Mgr of Enterprise Architecture

Leverage tooling and scripts to perform broad discovery and documentation of the current operational environments

Collaborate closely with IT Security and Risk departments to ensure Identity services are constructed and maintained in a manner consistent with access/identity management, data privacy, security, vulnerability, DR/BCP, and other risk management requirements

Identify functional and operational requirements with other IT teams, making service/solution recommendations within selected environments to ensure all requirements are met, this may include tooling selection for accomplishing strategic goals or meeting project requirements

Work directly in Azure and On-Prem AD environments to deploy, manage, and transform legacy Identity models to newer, modern standards

Utilize a data-driven, objective approach to inform decision-making, and provide and maintain clearly written documentation for technical and/or nontechnical teams, including support documentation for the helpdesk and application development teams

You’ll work closely with our Principal IAM Architect, contributing towards that effort by focusing on authentication and access management; working to transform and improve ABK’s authentication and authorization experience, using single-sign-on (SSO), multi-factor (MFA) and other novel authentication and access management technologies. Placing identity at the center of the security decision making process, you’ll have the opportunity to work on critical pivotal initiatives for our enterprise and get to implement and work with innovative technologies in the space.

The ideal candidate will already have extensive experience working with modern enterprise authentication and access management technologies in a fast paced technology environment.

Act as an SME relating to all aspects of authentication and access management, to include frontend systems/interfaces and backend providers
Support technical integration needs that facilitate connectivity between SSO, MFA and other authentication mechanisms, enterprise directory and identity provisioning tool(s)
Drive adoption of SSO for authentication, always looking for ways to encourage updates from legacy authentication schemes
Generate and develop reports, rules, dashboards and policies to identify and alert on compliance issues
Partner with IT, Security Architecture and Engineering teams to:
Conduct a gap assessment of current Microsoft Active Directory/Azure AD security best practices, designing and implementing controls to enhance security posture and monitoring capabilities
Design and implement an enterprise wide privileged access management (PAM) solution
Design and implement an enterprise wide Zero Sign-On/Passwordless authentication solution
Partner with our Security Operations team and other stakeholders to develop behavioral detections, alerting and response plans for anomalous authentication activities
Partner with IT team to design, implement and migrate to a single unified authentication directory
Continuously developing our capabilities to support modern connectivity, authentication and authorization requirements
Helping our IT team solve user issues and providing accurate documentation
Identify gaps in current processes, documentation, workflows and design solutions; recommending and/or delivering changes or enhancements as needed to improve clarity, efficiency and scalability of our offerings
Collaborate with Principal IAM Architect, IT, and other Security teams to define IAM Standards and Specifications.

Player Profile

Several years hands-on experience as an IAM/SSO engineer or Microsoft Active Directory administrator
Experience securing, administering and integrating applications to enterprise SSO/authentication platforms, e.g. Microsoft Active Directory, Azure AD, Okta, Ping Identity, Duo etc..
Intimate knowledge of authentication protocols such as LDAP, Kerberos, SAML, OpenID Connect, oAuth, MFA etc..
Knowledge of IAM and authentication frameworks in cloud environments
Experience working on systems integration projects
Good understanding of information security and IAM best practices and principles
Good interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical collaborators
Ability to solve problems independently and drive collaboration with the immediate team and external teams as needed to meet strategic goals
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
Willing to travel occasionally

Extra Points

BSc in Computer Science, Cyber/Information Security or other related field or experience
Experience with Sailpoint IdentityIQ or other identity governance solutions
Knowledge of cloud computing architectures, technical designs and implementations, including Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS)

POSITION SUMMARY

The Systems Analyst, Identity and Access will be a significant contributor on the Enterprise Directory Services Team that will conceptualize, design, and implement identity management systems for a diverse operational ecosystem. The ideal candidate is someone with recent technical experience in Active Directory technologies, Azure AD, SSO, and other components of AD domain and forest management. This role will be focused on supporting the IAM Engineer and IAM Architect, leading with best practice-based design principles and proscriptive technical guidance. The team is responsible for delivering strategic recommendations to many operations teams, working towards resolving technical debt, providing support for new strategic initiatives, and solutioning for the future. This role is a great opportunity to learn more about the Ski industry and work with a team to define the future of workforce identity at Alterra.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

General Responsibilities:

Responsible for timely delivery of projects as assigned by the Sr. Mgr of Enterprise Architecture

Have a strong natural grasp for IT fundamentals in networks, systems, and applications, especially as it relates to Active Directory/Azure AD management, reporting, and discovery

Leverage tooling and scripts to perform broad discovery and documentation of the current operational environments

Serve on the cross functional project team that will be responsible for designing and implementing a single workforce identity for all current operational domains, applications, and operational disciplines

Support the ongoing enterprise-wide domain management, partnering with operations teams in the iterative improvement of business supporting infrastructure, and assist the Enterprise Directory Services Team in defining, solutioning towards, and delivering the future operational environment

Assist in the maintenance of Microsoft on-prem and cloud IAM environments, with Azure Active Directory and Hybrid Identities

Collaborate closely with IT Security and Risk departments to ensure Identity services are constructed and maintained in a manner consistent with access/identity management, data privacy, security, vulnerability, DR/BCP, and other risk management requirements

Identify functional and operational requirements with other IT teams, making service/solution recommendations within selected environments to ensure all requirements are met, this may include tooling selection for accomplishing strategic goals or meeting project requirements

Work directly in Azure and On-Prem AD environments to deploy, manage, and transform legacy Identity models to newer, modern standards

Utilize a data-driven, objective approach to inform decision-making, and provide and maintain clearly written documentation for technical and/or nontechnical teams, including support documentation for the helpdesk and application development teams
